item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn Of War 4 Gets First Trailer at Gamescom 2025
item.content:encoded:
Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War 4 has been revealed at Gamescom in an epic new trailer that shows off multiple factions from the 40K universe.

In the grim darkness of the far future, there is no time for peace, but there is time for fun as Warhammer 40,000: Dawn Of War 4 has been revealed at Gamescom with a bombastic new trailer that sees Space Marines battling Necrons and much more.

Like the previous three games, Dawn of War 4 will be a real-time strategy game rather than a third-person shooter like Space Marine 2. Players control the Blood Ravens chapter of Space Marines, but will also be able to play as three other factions, including the Adeptus Mechanicus, Orks, and the Necrons.

item.title: Pac-Man and Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds Crossover Announced at Gamescom 2025
item.content:encoded:
A crossover between Pac-Man and Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds has been announced at Gamescom 2025, with both mascots invading each other’s worlds.

Pac-Man and Sonic are both retro gaming icons, and now their worlds are set to collide in a big way. Announced at Gamescom 2025 with a new trailer, the crossover will see Pac-Man appearing as a character in Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds, and with Sonic coming to Pac-Man World 2: Re-Pac.

The crossover will work as two separate DLC packs, one for each game, containing the other character.

item.title: LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight Revealed at Gamescom ONL
item.content:encoded:
LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight has been revealed at Gamescom Opening Night Live, and fans of the caped crusader are going to be thrilled about this one.

LEGO has recently been announcing a variety of new games. Most notably, they revealed LEGO Party, which is set to release in September and could compete with Mario Party. Additionally, a LEGO Voyagers game is expected to launch soon. Interestingly, the LEGO Batman game announced today confirms earlier leaks that it will receive treatment similar to that of LEGO Star Wars: Skywalker Saga.

LEGO Batman will feature a number of classic characters

“LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight is a brand-new open world action adventure videogame that invites players to embark on Bruce Wayne’s epic journey to become the hero of Gotham City, inspired by decades of Batman films, television, comic books, and games, and jam-packed with Batman nostalgia, DC lore, and TT Games’ signature brand of fun-filled LEGO humor,” the trailer’s description reads.

Check out the LEGO Batman trailer below. The game is set to launch in 2026 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC.

The upcoming LEGO Batman game is being developed by TT Games, just like the Skywalker Saga and the previous Batman titles. The last LEGO Batman game released was “Batman 3: Beyond Gotham” in 2014. Unlike earlier games that drew inspiration from comic books, this new installment focuses exclusively on content from live-action films. Players will not only be able to meet and interact with the characters they saw in the movies, but also play as many of them.

item.title: Lords of the Fallen 2 Revealed at Gamescom ONL
item.content:encoded:
The next souls-like adventure by CI Games, Lords of the Fallen 2, has been finally revealed at Gamescom Opening Night Live (ONL) 2025, arriving in 2026

August seems to be a great month for Lords of the Fallen fans, as CI Games has been constantly coming up with new announcements. At the start of this month, the title received a permanent price cut (over 50% for consoles) across all platforms. Lords of the Fallen 2 was confirmed soon after, and now we have the official reveal.

Lords of the Fallen 2 Reveal Trailer Features New Gory Combat

“Lords of the Fallen II is a dark fantasy action-RPG where brutal, soulslike combat meets a world splitting at its core,” the trailer’s description reads. “Battle against the darkness in an epic adventure across a shattered kingdom. One world. Two realms. No mercy.”

About Lords of the Fallen

While you wait for Lords of the Fallen 2, you might want to check out the original game first. The first title is a souls-like, RPG adventure where the player journeys through two expansive interconnected worlds to overthrow the demon God Adyr. There are more than 100 weapons to master, along with devastating magic abilities to take on a variety of enemies and bosses.

The game also features an advanced game modifier system that allows players to customise their journeys even further, including adjusting enemy density, randomised loot, pre-upgraded weapons, permadeath, and more. There are nine classes, each with its unique skill trees and upgrades. Interested players can also check out the online co-op mode.

Lords of the Fallen Version 2.0 Update

The game recently received a massive update, version 2.0, which overhauled certain systems, introduced new features, and addressed numerous issues. The update includes shared-progression crossplay co-op, a free friend’s pass, revamped combat and movement, a dedicated jump button, a full weapon audio overhaul, modernized UI & HUD options, an improved tutorial experience, and Umbral Lamp guidance.
